channel.title: Sports
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Sports, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kansas to face Duke Without Star Guard Darryn Peterson
item.description: The injured freshman phenom will miss Tuesday's primetime game, marking his third absence of the season.

item.title: USA Coach Mauricio Pochettino Lauds 'Hero' Marcelo Bielsa Ahead of Reunion With Uruguay Boss
item.description: United States coach Mauricio Pochettino is relishing his reunion with his mentor, Uruguay boss Marcelo Bielsa.

item.title: RJ Young's 24-Team College Football Playoff Bracket Entering Week 13
item.description: FOX Sports' RJ Young unveils the latest edition of his ultimate 24-team College Football Playoff bracket heading into Week 13.

item.title: Bicycle Kick, Red Card and 6 Goals: Scotland Qualifies For World Cup In Dramatic Fashion
item.description: Scott McTominay scored a superb bicycle kick goal three minutes into Scotland’s match against Denmark in European qualifying for the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Who Is … Rams Star Wide Receiver Puka Nacua?
item.description: In a Q&A with FOX Sports, Puka Nacua re-iterated his plans to retire from the NFL when he turns 30 and what it's been like to play with Sean McVay.

item.title: 'He's already unlocked things': Why the Magic needed Desmond Bane
item.description: Orlando is hoping its all-in approach for Desmond Bane will help stars Paolo Banchero and Franz Wagner win a championship.

item.title: Kiffin denies ultimatum by Ole Miss: 'Not true'
item.description: Ole Miss coach Lane Kiffin on Tuesday denied he has been given an ultimatum from the administration to make a decision about his future with the Rebel...

item.title: LeBron out, Curry unlikely to play in '28 Olympics
item.description: In a recent podcast, Lakers star LeBron James said he'll be "watching" the 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles, while Warriors star Stephen Curry "highly" do...

item.title: Fixing the Mavs: Why there's no cure-all for this Dallas disaster
item.description: Can this mess be fixed? Our NBA insiders are breaking down the Mavs' options amid a tumultuous 4-10 start.

item.title: Tomlin: Rodgers doesn't need surgery, status TBD
item.description: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers will not need surgery to repair a fracture to his left wrist, coach Mike Tomlin announced Tuesday.
